names.english: ginseng decoction to sedate the lungs
names.commonEnglish: Ginseng Decoction to Sedate the Lungs

actions: Drains Fire and detoxifies.
With Zhi Zi, powerfully clears and drains lurking Heat from the Lungs.
With Da Huang, for constipation.
Clears Heat, reduces Fire and eliminates irritability.
With Da Huang, for constipation.
Disperses Wind-Heat, cools and clears the head and eyes and benefits the throat.
Promotes the movement of Qi and reduces distention and pressure.
With Jie Geng, regulates the flow of Qi in the chest and aids in the transformation of Phlegm for chest congestion.
Stops cough, calms wheezing, moistens the Intestines and unblocks bowels.
Clears Heat (especially in the Upper Jiao), relieves toxicity, reduces abscesses and dissipates clumps.
Drains Heat from the Lungs, stops cough and calms wheezing.
With Huang Qin, drains Heat from the Lungs, and stops cough and wheezing.
Opens the Lungs, spreads Lung Qi, expels Phlegm, benefits the throat and raises Lung Qi, directing the effects of other herbs to the upper body.

With Gan Cao, disseminates Lung Qi, expels Phlegm, resolves toxicity, and expels pus for productive cough with hoarseness and pain and swelling of the throat due to Wind-Heat and Lung abscess with expectoration of pus and pain in the chest and flanks.
With Huang Qin and Gan Cao, for hoarseness, pain and swelling of the throat due to Wind-Heat
Clears Heat and eliminates Phlegm.
Tonifies Lung Qi and tonifies Qi in Deficiency patients with Exterior conditions.
Moistens the Lungs, resolves Phlegm, stops cough and moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs.
Clears Heat
Sedates the Lungs
Eliminates Phlegm
Regulates Qi

symptoms: Fullness and distention in the chest and epigastrium

modifications.modification: + Clear the Lung Decoction Qing Fei Tang
